commit.title: Ruby 1.9.3 shipped with rubygems 1.8.6.1, so minimum rubygems version is redundant
Add hint on where one can acquire twurl
[fix] allowing raw request body when Content-Type is already specified
Don't package test files with gem [ci skip]
Updated Install file with rake commands provided by install_tasks
Flip secret bit to enable Docker builds
Fixed the URL to register new Twitter apps
Tests to cover --raw-data, which should fix #33
CGI::parse() returns hash of arrays, but we need a string
Added --raw-data to send pre-URL-encode data as is
update gemspec to new github path
update help text, fix for issue 41
fix issue that corrupts .twurlrc file when setting default profile to profile name shorter that existing default
add ability to post multipart messages for media upload
removing protocal from host; escaping uri params; showing help on no twurl path
Update tests to use latest version of minitest
Update tests to use latest version of rr
Loosen required_rubygems_version for compatibility with Ubuntu 10.04
Add Coveralls for code coverage reporting
The source :rubygems is deprecated because HTTP requests are insecure.
Use of custom objects is not necessary here
Pass parameters with string keys to OAuth client
Remove executable attributes and shebang line
Output HTTP responses incrementally, in order to allow use of the streaming API
RCFile should not be world readable
Exclude tests from code coverage report
Manually implement attr_accessor methods on eigenclass
Convert directory from an instance variable into a class variable
Don't rely on environment to get home directory
Don't start SimpleCov during CI builds
Test in both 1.8 and 1.9 mode on JRuby and Rubinius
Add a command line option to set the HTTP proxy
Respect the -q flag by using the right output.
Fix the intentional typo that @marcel put in just for me to fix
Update gemspec and README to add erik
Bump version number and explicitly require rubygems
Replace rcov with simplecov for Ruby 1.9 support
Bump version number after adding the -A/--header option that Jake Donham contributed.
Add the -A/--header command line option to support adding a header to the request.
The order that files are returned by Dir.glob is platform dependent. Ensure the order is consistantly ordered.
Print responses without newlines (more like cURL)
Ensure VERSION constants are only defined once (clean up warnings)
Move gemspec into a file (prepare for Bundler)

allowing you to do auth without having a ~/.twurlrc file first. because the user doesn't provide the username parameter when first authorizing, this will make a call to verify_credentials to get the username.
Change capitalization of curl and bump version number to appease rubygems.org.
Add instructions on how to install via gem.
Add basic information on installing twurl to the INSTALL file.
Update homepage in gem spec to point to github.
Remove extraneous Rake tasks and add Raffi to the gemspec.
Adding our twitter usernames to the README
modifying the README to refer to xAuth
Replace redudant tutorial file with readme.
Add explicit require for yaml library.
falling back to PIN based authentication if the application doesn't have xAuth support
Extract the configuration of the http object into a specialized method.
Push option defaults down into Options class.
Stick Options on Twurl since Twurl can be used as a library and not just via the CLI.
Extract error message for an unrecognized setting in the configuration controller.
Finish initial implementation of aliases controller with tests.
Test coverage for the account information controller as well as support for setting configuration values (currently only the default profile)
Rather than bubble up a URI exception if no URI is provided, present an error message.
Add section on adding aliases to the tutorial.
Initial support for aliases and subcommands.
Update account information controller now that accounts can have multiple consumer keys.
Key default profile by both username and consumer key so that the same username with multiple consumer keys can switch keys around.
Replace options.output.puts with new CLI.puts interface.
Test coverage for the OAuthClient methods that make requests.
OAuthClient test coverage for client loading from RCFile.
Ensure output is always set whether options get parsed or not.
Support 'accounts' command to list authorized accounts.
Cleaned up optional argument option definitions. Make interactive prompts for consumer key and secret options. Fixed typos.
Move to internal exceptions with just one abort rather than aborts all over the place to lend the code to be used as a library as well as a CLI client.
Add gem generating task and add MIT license.
Switch oauth client authorization from ad hoc request token / access token exchange to use new credential / access token exchange.
Split out inline option declaration into more succinct methods.
Test coverage for specifying a request method.
Initial test coverage for request method parsing.
Initial test coverage for option parsing and command dispatch.
Add documentation for as-of-yet unsupported --request-method/-X CLI option.

issues.title: authorize command is not propery syntax checked
Including = symbol in JSON post body causes body to become truncated
Tweet with image fails with error 32
Tweet from other profile without set default
Please add support for the new metadata endpoint
Trouble getting twurl utility working with Ads API Advertiser API api ads
Help with posting an update with an image
Post Tweet with Media and Geo Tag
output is not pipeable | to programs like grep, not able to be redirected > to a file, etc
HTTP Post data not encoded properly under 1.9.3
-F does not default to "media" (or any other value)
how to specify geocode in twurl
Save authentification and load at next twurl request
How to save the output after connecting to Streaming API?
twurl does not post status that contains an ampersand
Any way to see both Access Token + Secret?
Twitter REST API v1 is no longer active.
Where should I run rake dist:gem?
How could i usr twurl with a proxy
Twurl installation breaks during "twurl authorize" using "username" literally
Feature Request: username selection command line option
require File.dirname(__FILE__) + '/lib/twurl' doesn't work for me -- the Twurl::AbstractCommandController  error
Feature Request: "pretend mode" that outputs OAuth authorization header

pulls.title: Add hint on where one can acquire twurl
added different hosts and binary uploads
[fix] Allowing raw request body when Content-Type is already specified
Updated Install file with rake commands provided by install_tasks
add twurl version to user agent header
Added --raw-data to send pre-URL-encoded data as is
rename README and reformatted to markdown
fix issue that corrupts .twurlrc file when setting default profile
Add multi-part message support for update_with_media endpoint
Add ability to set consumer names
Enable use of the streaming API
Add a command line option for HTTP proxy support
